title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, friendly environment. Offered the job on the spot. Very informative of the position and answered all of my questions as well. The hospital was clean, organized, smiling faces everywhere.
Interview Questions: First question : tell me about yourself

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with my immediate supervisor. It was more of an informal interview. The second interview was a panel interview with several leadership members from different departments in nursing and IT.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Pct Med Surg Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Introduced themselves. There were 5 of them. Asked if I had any questions. Described the roll of the job and all about the floor. Asked me about myself. Then asked behavioral questions. Then offered me the job.
Interview Questions: -can you explain a situation where you have made a mistake? What did you do about it? -can you give an example of how you have identified and reported a patients change in condition to the nursing staff? -Tell me about a time when you received negative feedback or were criticized and how you dealt with that situation. -provide an example of a time when you went above and beyond to care or a patient or something like when I did gave exceptional care and the patient told someone about it etc

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant! A thoughtful experience with a great team of individuals with whom I enjoyed meeting. The questions were original but not too out of the box and the team came to a decision quickly.
Interview Questions: They asked about my plans for growth in my career.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview is conducted first with the hiring manager either over the phone or in person. The applicant is then shown around the unit or area is which they will be working. A peer interview is conducted utilizing behavior based questioning. The applicat must answer the questions using the STAR method. They must describe the Situation, Task, Action, and Results while answering the question.
Interview Questions: Can you explain a situation when you have made a mistake? What did you do about it?

title: Clinical Reserearch Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly smooth- I received a few challenging questions that were inciteful. The interviewer was really nice and easygoing. There were several steps to the interview process.
Interview Questions: What do you feel is the biggest problem the healthcare system is facing today?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, know your strengths and weaknesses. Know what you would do in conflict. Have questions to ask back. And just be yourself. It is a good company to work for.
Interview Questions: What did you do in a conflict situation?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: very easy, they made me laugh and feel comfortable. we spoke alot about the company and about expectations for the job. I asked them alot of questions about nurse culture on the unit, retention, and resources.
Interview Questions: why do i want to work there, my goals

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: There were two virtual interviews, one with the direct report boss and one with a coworker. Very simple questions about personality, work history, and goals. Quick and easy, but probably department dependent and depending on the particular research project.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Online application was followed by an in person meeting with the director of the department. I was asked a series of questions and had my questions answered. I also toured the facility.
Interview Questions: Have you ever done clinical research before?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Thorough interview, had a pleasant time speaking with the Dean of the College I was interviewing with. Asked very thoughtful questions and was very up-front with me about what they were looking for.
Interview Questions: What made you apply for this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: In person peer interview. Met with manager and 2 other RNs from the floor. Was asked 5 questions behavioral question. 2 days later was extended an offer. Was given tour of the unit and introduced to multiple staff members
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions tell me about a time

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a regular interview but it was longer than I expected. They started with a peer interview and then a manager interview. The questions they used were basic psychological ones and they were asked several times in different ways.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you have to work in a team.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions:
The interview with Dr. Colleen Halliday for the research assistant position was fairly normal, primarily consisting of behavioral interview questions. A few of the questions she asked were odd but not too alarming...

I waited nearly 2 months to hear a response, and she never got back to me. I think it's disrespectful to not follow up with people that take time out of their day to prepare and interview.  A simple, "Thank you for your time. I decided to go with another candidate," would have sufficed.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why do you want this job
Q: What are your short term and long term goals
Q: Are you comfortable working with diverse groups
Q: Greatest weakness and greatest strength

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral-based questions, Peer team input.  MUSC is very thorough and excellent in hiring processes.  They strive to hire the perfect fit, not just a candidate that "will do".  The process was smooth and deliberate.
Interview Questions: Multiple behavorial-based questions.  EAR response model dictates detailed question & answer.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: application process was part of the new gradate nursing program. Hundreds of interviews were conducted this day for all of the various departments. Interviewed with 3 leadership members for unit.
Interview Questions: How to contribute to quality improvement

title: Financial Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Surprisingly quick and efficient. Received an email the day I applied with an interview scheduled for the following day.  Scheduled two interviews - one with the hiring manager and another with current analysts.  Offer received within three days of applying.
Interview Questions: How would your  previous experience benefit this role?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: the interview process included a phone call with the manager and then a zoom call peer interview with other staff nurses from the mother baby antepartum unit. It was very average as far as interviews for staff positions go.
Interview Questions: tell us about a time you made a mistake

title: Certified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: it was okay not too much pressure just be yourself you got it good luck if your nervous try to look confident i wish you the best i know you can do it
Interview Questions: it wasnt too many questions

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: The interviewed patient was overall simple and straightforward.  They want to know who you are as a person and who you want to be within your role in healthcare.  I suggest making sure you have a general idea of the role you're applying too.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Threes different interviews - one with the recruiter, then one with the manager, then a peer interview.  No feedback provided and took weeks to hear anything back from the first interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, ideal position, salary

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: multiple mini interviews.  unclear criteria on how to perform well.  people are flakey at best and aren’t honest upfront.  always say they have a better candidate and don’t provide feedback after
Interview Questions: how to you incorporate diversity into your work?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: I cannot get past the HR computer system for my resume to be viewed by humans to land an interview....  I have been applying for a few years like many MUSC employees before they got hired...
Interview Questions: Sorry, I have no idea aside from rumors of typical behavioral questions...

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: It was a structured timed interview. The interviewer did not try to establish a comfortable setting and the first question was tell me about a time you handled this experience. I expected the tell me about yourself question. She made me feel like I was a sheep. It was rushed and very robotic.
Interview Questions: How you handle different situations

title: Therapeutic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy going and a lot of work performance questions were asked.  The interviewers were very nice and easy to talk to. Good description of the job were given
Interview Questions: When was a time that you had to display leadership?

title: OTD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews. One interview is with a therapist in the community and the other two are with faculty. They went well, the interviews are short and the day also includes a tour.
Interview Questions: How have you experienced diversity?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Welcoming and warm interviewers made for a comfortable process.  I interviewed for a position and then followed up.  They let me know that they selected someone else, but then called back to offer me a more senior role.  I was not able to accept, but appreciated the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Intern I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: interviews with preceptors, behavioral questions but casual, more of a conversation than anything. Have questions ready for them. They want the help of an intern, so make sure to ensure you want to be there
Interview Questions: When was a time you had a conflict with a team member and how did you resolve it

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: great 2 interview one with manger & then the team. They asked behavior questions that were easy to answer . you don’t have to be qualified to get the interview but at least seem interested
Interview Questions: describe a time where you went above and beyond for your co worker

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Went smoothly. Multiple department heads in one interview. Very simple questions asked. Told about myself and college experience.  Only one person was really asking questions. A bit nerve-wracking, but not too bad.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself and why you think you'd be good for this position."

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: MUSC always does peer interviews so my first interview was with the manager and coordinator.My second interview was with two techs.They only offered $15.10 so I declined.I called and emailed the manager asking if we could discuss the salary and he never returned my call.That was so unprofessional.
Interview Questions:
Have you ever been in a situation where you had to rearrange your schedule?
What would you do if you were asked to do something and you felt it was out of your job description?
How do handle stressful situations?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy and quick. I saw the listing online on multiple job sites and MUSC's. I uploaded my resume and I included my credentials. I was then contacted for a interview.
Interview Questions: What is a strength you have?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: They tell you about the unit and then expect you to ask questions and sell yourself.  If they are interested they then schedule you for a behavioral interview with other members of the staff
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified for this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Difficult questions you can find a book of them online if you search for MUSC interview questions. It will be a large pdf file and it will explain the categories and give samples of all questions
Interview Questions: How would you handle x - patient scenario, needing to break the chain of command

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: It went well in my opinion.  The people were nice.   There were two interviews.  One with a supervisor and one with a panel of peers.   The campus is pretty large.
Interview Questions: There were several used off of a set questionnaire.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was a two-step process. The first inteview was on the phone (During COVID) with the intended supervisor and the second was with the future co-workers which was in-person. They took some time to deliberate and got back to me pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: They have a set of behavioral style questions.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: the mentor read my CV and scheduled a phone interview. she asked what my career goal in the next 5 years and what lab skills do I have. She requested one reference and told me to inform her as soon as my OPT application got approved.
Interview Questions: what is your visa status?

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Received an e-mail from an employee, requesting that I, the applicant, set up a time with another employee to have a "conversation" about the position. 

In the phone call, the interviewer seemed completely disinterested. The "conversation" was a behavioral interview where the employee asked me a serious of scripted questions (all this happened before giving me any real background on the job). 

I never heard back from them at all (not suprised) and considered the whole interview process to be bizarre. I am not interested in working for this company.
Interview Questions:
Name a time you improved a process etc. 

Just search behavioral interview questions, the interview was reading from a script.

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (North Charleston, SC) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online on the MUSC webiste
after about two-three weeks i got notification via email that somebody wanted to chat with me 
The same day I was contacted and we talked a little about me and then she scheduled the interview for the following week.
It was on phone interview and about a hour of so later I was offered a job
Now she waiting on HR to negotiate a salary letter and accept the offer
Interview Questions: Described a time in where you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: They sent me and email and requested a phone interview. After the phone interview, they requested a video conference. A few days after, I got an email stating they went with somebody else.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you are interested in this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with manager, webex meeting with three or four of the other administrative assistants and then had another webex with three or four different physicians that I would potentially be working for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when........

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviews held virtually, separated by 2 weeks.  I met with the dept manager, medical director and team. Covid then put the position on hold.  The interviewers were attentive, thorough, thoughtful. The HR process was confusing but ultimately, I moved on due to the long wait for research to resume.
Interview Questions: Why should you be considered for this position? Do you have clinical and research experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
1 Phone Screen
2 Panel Interviews
They are looking to make a decision as soon as possible. Open with the fact that they are interviewing other candidates. Was able to meet (virtually) with other admin assistants. They were friendly, asked questions, was made very comfortable.
Interview Questions: I was asked multiple questions. Some standard interview questions others not. Overall, a great interview process.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email requesting an interview about 3 weeks later. It was a virtual interview with two of the hiring managers. They asked two questions and then asked if I had questions. It was very short, so I knew immediately they had already selected someone for the role and just “going through the motions.” The interview was over within 15 minutes and they said they would be in touch for a second round interview. Of course, I never heard back regarding a second interview. I also never received any notification from HR or the hiring managers stating they had selected another candidate, which is extremely unprofessional and disheartening . As one of the largest employers in the state, a simple generic email to candidates would suffice.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate for this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Went though an interview with the unit manager and then a peer team. Interview was basic but difficult behavioral questions, but the interview environment was positive and encouraging. The interview process was two steps (manager and then a panel) and they got back to me regarding employment status in a few days.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a difficult decision that you had to make and what did you do/learn from making the decision

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was 3 rounds of interviews. One with direct supervisor, one with medical director and the other with members from the team. They all asked the same questions. Team interview was different. They provided good insight to the expectations of the job
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you faced a challenge and how did you handle it?

title: Referral Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through MUSC career website. Received an email about two weeks later asking if I was still interested in the position. Scheduled an in person interview. First round of interview was with a 4 people panel of supervisors. They each asked one question. After that interview, I was taken into a room to complete a typing test. Upon completing the typing test, I was brought back to the original interview room, for a peer interview. Once again it was a panel interview, but it was very relaxed and easy going. Received a call the next day offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work in a team setting to accomplish a goal at work.

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: interview with the manager then peer interview. The peer interview asked four questions. They all were behavioral based questions, nothing pertaining to the job.  It was a little intimidating because it was with 5 people.
Interview Questions: scenario questions

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: 7 questions regarding your past experience, how much time you can work per week, and the unique attributes about yourself in particular, that would add to the team’s fundraising, community outreach, and alumni relations.
Interview Questions: How many days in a workweek do you think you could come in while you’re also in school?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a two part interview process. First there was an over the phone interview followed by an in person. I had to travel out there without reimbursement for my travels. Both interviews felt like more of a conversation than a formal interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Peer interview with at least 3 people. Asked questions such as experience, why I’m seeking new job, if I know anyone that works there, and described what duties would be
Interview Questions: Experience?

title: Registered Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: My interview was different in the sense that it took place over Webinex, since I live on the opposite side of the country. I was interviewed by a large panel (roughly 20 nurses), and everyone was extremely friendly. All questions were behavior based and answered in STAR format.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you failed, and how you overcame such failure.

title: Senior Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial HR phone conversation. There was then an interview with hiring manager, then on the same day directly after the hiring manager interview there followed a peer interview with 3 individuals from department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you worked with a difficult cowrker.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact through email followed by, meeting for One on one interview. This was a lab position got to know the result immediately but he end of interview. Joined position following week.
Interview Questions: Past experience and relavence to position

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: All interviews took place on the same day with the opportunity to interview in two areas. They were however very proficient. Offers were extended the next week. And interviews took place 2-3 months before the start date for the job for new grad RN's.
Interview Questions: How would coworkers or past managers describe you?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: I was a pre-doctoral psychology intern and expressed interest in a postdoctoral position. Based on my performance during internship, one was offered to me. I negotiated the balance between research and clinical work and was given what I asked for. I asked for a salary increase and was denied.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Therapeutic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It began with a interview with the Manager of the unit, then peer interview with two other therapeutic assistants on the unit, and then with two RN's on the unit.  All questions were behavioral and situational based.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had conflict with a difficult co-worker or patient.

title: Telehealth Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The manager was 25min late.  The conversation lasted 15 min.  The interviewer had not read my CV as she was astounded that I possessed experience in Telehealth.  It was a one on one interview.  I had questions about their process improvement procedures.—This is a great question considering that Telehealth is a new field.
Interview Questions: How do you get employees to embrace change?

title: Information Solutions Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an online application then was contacted by the hiring manager for the department seeking an intern. Then, I was selected among several applicants to come interview in person.
Interview Questions: What do you believe are some of the challenges for an academic medical center?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Team-based interview with upper managers as well as mid-level managers.  Everyone uses a set of questions that are predetermined.  Needs more diversity within their interview and hiring process.  Staff does not reflect population.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with difficult employees?

title: Senior Systems Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I't was a great interview process, I was able to talk with the hiring manager to work with my schedule in order for me to have an interview in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Research Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a one on one interview with a supervisor. They ask about your experience in health care, why you want to be a coordinator, what qualifies you for the job. They also ask about your long term goals.
Interview Questions: The interview was a one on one interview with a supervisor. They ask about your experience in health care, why you want to be a coordinator, what qualifies you for the job. They also ask about your long term goals.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Quick and to the point. My now manager was very communicative and worked with my schedule. Each interview only lasted a few minutes but asked sincere questions. I would suggest working at MUSC because of the quality of my coworkers and the benefits I receive. It is a wonderful position to begin working as it will help boost my resume for higher positions in the future.
Interview Questions: Will you be able to handle rejection or constructive criticism?

title: Statistical and Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process took less than a week once I was contacted about my application I had submitted a month prior. I had two interviews. The initial was over the phone with the professor I was going to be working with to determine if our working styles were similar and/or compatible. Second interview was the next day in person with the professor and one of the graduate students from her lab. Both lasted around 45 minutes. Very friendly and prepared, both the professor and graduate student had looked over my resume and had formulated their questions around gaining a deeper understanding of my experience(s).
Interview Questions: Are you a self-starter or do you work better being micro-managed?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Typically round table interview with multiple analyst and management separate. Went thru the typical questions asking about my experience. There was also a handful of canned situation interview questions, that were pretty easy to wing.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you had to argue against a majority opinion (in a job) and explain how you handled it.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions:
Meet the Project Investigator (PI) in person and get to know each other. PI asked questions about previous work and techniques known and how you can fit in the present project.
Gave powerpoint presentation about previous work to the group.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous work?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with members of the department that lasted about an hour.   Team members asked a series of behavioral questions as well as specific questions pertaining to my resume. Afterwards an Excel skills test was administered.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your Excel skills, on a  scale of 1-10?

title: College of Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with poor questions. They will repeat the same question. They are hasty and rude. The only reason for the phone interview is to meet the 3 interviewee requirement, meaning there is no intention to hire you. In my case, they already had someone for the job. Common across MUSC. Do not expect to get a fair hiring process or fair pay at MUSC.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple tasks?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions:
After getting asked for an interview and preparing for at least 6 hours, they called me back, less than 24 hours before the interview, and told me that they were no. longer interested because I did not have a master's degree. They would prefer to take someone with 5 to 7 years of experience with a master's degree over someone who has 19 years of applicable ave expert experience plus over 3 years of leadership coaching training and a coaching certification. 

One, how did I get through their screening process?  Two, how did the hiring manager accept my resume from HR if it didn't meet their standards?  Do your homework just like I did before wasting an applicant's time and mental energy.  This teaching hospital is struggling in the local community and they wonder why...
Interview Questions: Do you have a Master's Degree?

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Lancaster, SC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I got a call pretty quickly and set up the interview for later that week.  The interview was fun and I was offered the position that day.  I was able to tour the ED, speak with some of the charge nurses about what it was like to work in an emergency room. Then I went to HR. The on-boarding process was kind of long.
Interview Questions: What event has prepared me to work in the emergency department?

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Being such a large facility, I received a call back from applying 3 months prior. Manager called on a Monday afternoon, we scheduled an interview for Wednesday on the same week. Interview was about 2 hours long. Manager gave details about the position, changes that are occuring and exactly what the department is seeking.  I was shown a tour of the laboratory. Then, I was had a peer interview with experienced personnel of the laboratory.  Everyone was friendly!
Interview Questions: Give an example when you had to adapt to change?

title: Research Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: I talked to the Doctor in charge of the lab and he spent some time describing the position, the pay, and living in Charleston. We also talked about future goals and career paths. I ended up not getting the job, but he responded in about a week to let me know he had chosen another candidate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: A very thorough interview process. They are very pleasant and very efficient.  This is why they are one of the best  if not the best company to work for.
Interview Questions: How you feel about working in a diverse population?

title: Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Called for an interview. Went in for a panel inteview. Prior to the panel interview the supervisor will give you a few questions to vet you and see if you would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: They want specific events. Not generic answers.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Peer and manager interview in person, HR background checks and drug screenings as well as an in depth physical assessment. Peer interview questions are fairly standard and can be found online.
Interview Questions: How do you manage conflict amongst coworkers or disgruntled patients

title: Pct II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with manager first. Peer interview with 4 members on the unit. They were welcoming and so easy to talk to! Great place to work! Easy over all
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Well the hiring process was a lil complicated because they ask questions I know but in a different form but the interview went well and hopefully they give me a chance to work in there company because I am a real team player
Interview Questions: How well do I work around other people.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with direct supervisor and then department chair.  Typical interview questions revolving around skills, education, background and expectations.  Basic information sharing about position details and job description.  Helpful to ask questions about the mission of the department and the current science or studies the department is engaged in.  Quick turn around from interviews to decisions to offers.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you are interested in this position.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at the end of August and received an email about the position a few days later. I was interested so I was invited for an interview a week later. Then a follow up interview with the team a week or so after the first one.
Interview Questions: Was there a time in a past position where you had a problem or conflict and how did you resolve it.

title: Research Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Varies depending on Faculty member, I interviewed using a phone interview (preliminary) for one position and a Skype interview for a second. Interviews were scheduled using a brief phone call/email from the Faculty member of an administrative assistant just prior to interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your past research experience

title: General Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview was better than my career. Working / Interviewing with these people are day and night.  Write everything down! If they tell you, you'll get parking. Make sure it's in writing.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Skype/Phone interview initially then was asked to come in for an in person interview. Friendly staff, seemed open and honest about the role. Interested about my background and contributions to the project.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, have you worked with this patient population, when wold you be able to start?

title: Referral Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was quite easy to complete and HR helped to keep the process easy. They were helpful and answered any questions I may have had. They send a letter with dates and times as well as an email to ensure that you have a way of contact.
Interview Questions: Name a time that you had an physical to overcome?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I received an email asking for an interview, and once I got there, I was taken to a conference room for my interview. First, I met with members of the research team, then I met with the doctors who were running the study.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with research?

title: Research Specialist II Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I've interviewed at about 15 different labs and had about 5 offers.  Interviewed with the PI and maybe someone else who works in the lab.  I was asked several general biology and personal background questions.  Every interview will be different because it will be with a different PI but they all have the same basic theme
Interview Questions:
1) are you trying to use this position to get into grad school?
2) why did you choose my lab to apply to?
3) How long do you plan on staying in my lab?

title: Certified Sterile Processing Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: You meet with a few of the peir review and if one of them dont want you to work there then you are not hired. They do a drug screaning and background check. It was almost 6 weeks waiting to start work. Had to have at least 3 work years of experience if you dont have a certification. They give you the books to study for your certification. They also pay for you certification exam.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: telephone and a presentation. I was interviewed by the supervisor and then she asked me to give an oral presentation at the campus. I went to give the presentation and got an offer letter within one week.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weakness

title: Therapeutic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: No real interview. The job is described to you and then a tour of the facility. A few questions maybe about teamwork, how well you work with others, and how interested are you in working in the field.
Interview Questions: How do you handle downtime?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very well organized and everybody I met with was very helpful.  The entire process felt very seamless and I am satisfied with how everybody communicated and responded to all of my questions, both in person and over email.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you overcame a difficult situation?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is always the same.  Every department generally goes with behavioral-based questions.  If you get through the round with the manager, you are then invited to interview with a peer team.  The peer team will always use behavioral-based questions, as well. After you get through the peer team, they will make a decision on a candidate.  From there the manager will make the final decision then the chosen candiate gets an offer.
Interview Questions:
1. Can you explain a situation when you have made a mistake?  What did you do about it? 
2. Tell me about a time when you had to solve a problem with very little guidance or direction.
3. Describe a time in which you had to adjust quickly to changes over which you had no control.  What was the impact on you? On your work or project?
4. Give me an  example of a time when your job responsibilities changed and how you dealt with it. 
5.  Tell me about a time when you had a difficult time gathering needed information in order to complete a task?  How did you manage the process particularly as it relates to follow-up?
6. Tell me about a time when your received negative feedback on your performance by a co-worker and how you handled this situation.  
7. What types of things in your work have caused stress or made you uncomfortable? What did you do when those situations happened?

title: Research Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very fast and easy. Interviewer didn't try to ask me any trick questions. She just honestly wanted to get to know me and get a feel for the type of person I am.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great people, friendly and professional. Make sure to ask about your pay as well as what your roles and responsibilities will be and who you will report to if anyone.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research?

title: Senior Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was convenient and the interviewers were polite and asked great questions. They used behavioral based questions. However, they chose the right questions and asked additional questions based upon my answers. They were friendly and were positive when I responded to the questions.
Interview Questions: My experience and how I treated employees

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I emailed a professor at MUSC and had a few meetings with them. Really a typical way to get an academic position. There is nothing really special that I can attribute to this process.
Interview Questions: How they thought my graduate experience was going to affect my research during my postdoc.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Nursing Manager Interview then Peer Interview. Nursing manager interview was about 35 minutes. First part was developing rapport, asking questions, and selling myself. Second part was three behavioral questions. 

The peer interview included the charge nurse and three other nurses from the floor. They said that the behavioral questions were about 5% important compared to getting to know me. I discussed magnet status, my interest in MUSC, and he great things I heard about their unit/Nursing team. They asked me why I wanted to work in that specialty.
Interview Questions: Behavioral Questions. There is a packet of questions available online if you google "Musc behavioral questions". Almost always had a communication and prioritization question.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Get an Email to schedule a phone interview, 2 weeks after that was offered a whole -day on-site interview, I was told 4 candidates were considered for this position and I finally got an offer two months later.
Interview Questions: why you want apply at MUSC and general questions about your accomplishment. Also asked to give a presentation.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied and it took a few weeks to get a call. The interview was a 2 parter where I met with the nurse manager, then did a peer interview. Everyone was great and made it feel more like friends just talking together.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult patient/family experience you have dealt with?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I scheduled an appointment to meet with my boss now and it was a face-to-face interview. Afterwards I sat down with another employee and saw the kinds of things I would be doing.
Interview Questions: what days can you work

title: Alumni Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: When arriving at interview, I first met with the individuals who would be my direct boss. Then I was greeted by all employees of the Annual Giving team who would be my direct line of coworkers. Upon casual introductions, I was given a tour of important buildings and met some head of departments I would be working closely with- Medicine and College of Health Professions were the two that were available that day. I was then taken to lunch and had casual conversation with the team. I was able to meet a few of the individuals who would be working under me. I was then sent to HR to communicate the necessary information they would need if I was hired.
Interview Questions: How to do you manage your time?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a telephone call for a phone screen. After which, an in-person interview was scheduled. The day of the interview I met with two managers and then had a 4-person peer interview. Everyone was very nice and the process was explained beforehand. The entire process took about 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Please describe a time when your process or working with a coworker failed. How did you handle?

title: Registered Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: This facility utilizes a peer interview process that consists of select members of the unit that have been through a training class to conduct this type of interview.  In most instances, the job candidate will first interview with the unit Manager/Director, and either immediately proceed to a peer interview or be notified at a later date if they have been selected to be interviewed by the peer interview team.  The peer interview consisted usually 2-4 members of the unit (that have been selected to be a part of this panel, and who have been trained to conduct peer-interviews) asking the job candidate behavioral-based interview questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your worst shift at work, when nothing seemed to be going right or maybe you were so busy that you felt like you would never catch up.  How did you handle the situation?

title: Regulatory Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the head Study Coordinator first, and then I met with the other study coordinators in the department, and in the end, I met with the head doctor for the department for which I applied for.
Interview Questions: Familiarity with the clinical study application process.

title: Research Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a few interviews here - most went really well, another was awful, so it really depends on which lab you apply to. They asked really standard interview questions. Each lasted about 45 min. One professor in particular was rude and acted like interviewing me was a complete waste of his time. Not sure why he invited me.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your long term career plans

title: Program Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very laid back. It was very conversational and easy. The interviewers usually met with you and then took you to another conference room to meet other staff members. Sometimes people were called into the room and then asked to leave and then they brought in a new interviewer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current job? What kind of programs do you use? When are you available to start?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The first time I applied I received a call to schedule an interview, which I promptly returned the call. After a week of not hearing anything back I called again only to find out that they had missed my initial message and had offered the job to someone else. 

The second time I applied for this role, I had an interview with manager scheduled then asked to come back for an afternoon of interviews (1 with business manager, 1 with administrator, and one with 5 coworkers). This is the standard process for interviews in the organization.
Interview Questions: There is a standard list of questions "Tell me of a time when..."

title: Systems Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and than I had a face to face the process took about two to three week. Over process was average just time length was long. The in-person interview was very laid back and relaxed.
Interview Questions: There was not difficult questions.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very positive for the   IOP versus having several pending apps for the main hospital. The environment and staff were very friendly and professional. I applied and was called back within a  couple of weeks for an interview. It was a panel interview with employees from different disciplines. Questions were fair and job oriented such as examples of hard decisions made in the past, skill based questions, what do you think that you could offer to the the organization etc.
Interview Questions: Give an example when you believed that your integrity was questioned?

title: Phlebotomy Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position on Indeed.com, and I received a call two days later. After a brief telephone pre-interview, she asked me to come in for a formal interview that following Monday. The interview process was excellent. The person who interviewed me was extremely personable and made me feel very comfortable and relaxed. She even took the time to escort me around, show me the facility, and introduce me to the other staff members. The process itself was not difficult, although she asked several questions that challenged me, and would have made me sweat a little had I not practiced the night before. Overall a pleasurable and rewarding experience. She offered me the job less than 24 hours after the interview, which I was happy to accept.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral questions about past work experience and how I handled certain situations and/or people. Nothing too difficult, though some preparation the day before helped immensely.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager first then had a peer review with 3 staff nurses. The questions were situational based. So for example "Tell us of time you used clinical judgement to help plan a patients care?" And then you tell a story.
Interview Questions: They asked how I felt I communicated?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Called in by the unit secretary to schedule an interview with management. During initial interview, met with the 3 managers of the unit (1 manager and 2 assistant managers). It was very comfortable and they started off with the typical "tell us about yourself". I felt like the interview with management was pretty self directed as long as you went in with an idea of what you wanted to convey. Next step was a peer interview where you got the typical behavioral type questions ("tell me about a time when....") It was with 2 staff nurses from the unit. Was called back about a week later with a tentative start date.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Senior Campaign Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in late June and finally got a call to schedule a phone interview in late August. This was the start of a very dragged out process with a group interview next, skills test, then interviews with hospital execs for final interview over nearly 5 mo!
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very disorganized, they know who they want to hire before they call in applicants.  Very much of an good old boy system, HR does not care about employees they only care about the bottom line and pleasing the physicians.
Interview Questions: What interested you in healthcare

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC)
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial interview and then a peer intevview. The initial interview lasted maybe 5-10 minutes, the peer interview was a little longer but they simply asked questions about current work situations and what if situations, not to difficult.
Interview Questions: I don't think there was anything to difficult to answer.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The questions that they will ask you is on their website I'm not stating exactly where but it's there.  It was a panel interview with your peers meaning other pharmacy techs. Questions were the typical interview questions it was super easy
Interview Questions: If there was down time in the pharmacy what would you do during that time?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had to make a 10 to 15 minute presentation to teach three instructional designers how to do something of my choosing. After the presentation, I met with a team lead for 5 minutes and hired me on the spot.
Interview Questions: No real questions. You just have to teach three people on staff how to do something.

title: Program Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: HR department will try to nickel and dime you about your pay status.  Hard to achieve a raise even after having good work experience.  Each interview is pretty unique but the orientation and benefits seminars are the same
Interview Questions: There were no questions that surprised me

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with mix of current staff and managers; average interview process; first interviewed with unit manager one-on-one, then with mixed panel; great opportunity for the staff to get to meet me and for me to as questions; heard back from the unit within two weeks and then started one month later in an orientation group; completed on site health assessment and drug screen before working on the unit
Interview Questions: Experience; why do you want to work here?

title: Revenue Systems Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process is very straightforward. They call you for an individual interview with the coordinator/manager of your department. After the decision is made to move you forward you go to the peer interviews. There is typically a panel of 3-4 of your coworkers who will be working either with you directly or will work with you from a different department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: follow up interview
Interview Questions: weakness

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions:
I had a phone interview, interview with four managers and finally a peer/group interview.  The process wasn't very difficult.  It just seemed like a lot of interviews, but this is standard for this industry.  The team seemed to be very outgoing and very much a cohesive unit.  

Everyone seemed very friendly and the position seemed like a good fit.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had to get information from someone to resolve a customer's issue, but that person would not get to back to you so that you could continue your work?

title: Project Manager Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston Crossroads, SC) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Started out by phone as I lived in Ohio
Interview Questions: They thought I was overqualified

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Online application, if a math you will receive an initial interview with potential second interview. The process is slow, sometime can take a month overall
Interview Questions: They are the typical interview questions, your strength your weaknesses, name a time when.... and how did you handle it.

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Peer Interview program in place. Interviewed by two Anesthesia Technicians and one Nurse Anesthetist.  Fairly basic questions from a script, plenty of time to answer and expand.  Some questions borderline, about marital status and plans for school/further education. Overall a pleasant interview with people who would be direct colleagues.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan on staying here? (Coupled with my recent marriage and plans to pursue a degree). This seemed odd that they want to know when you will leave.  This left a bad taste like a revolving door situation. I applied to stay for a long time, but they were stuck on me leaving soon.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina
Interview Descriptions: Required cover letter and interview with 4 faculty members.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Difficult to get in as a new grad RN, chances improve if you work as a tech on the floor while you are in nursing school.  First you meet in person with nurse manager.  Then, peer review interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral type questions: Tell me a time when you encountered conflict with a boss.

title: Staff Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Talked with staff and radiologist. Was shown various departments. Ironically never asked to scan a patient or asked specific questions about my skills as previous coordinator? It was more of a personality interview than a specific skill set...unusual.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with other managers and Director. Described what I would bring to the position to help it grow based on my expertise and past experience. Casual interview sitting around room with managers.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to increase sales.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was with staff leaders, 2nd with group manager. 3rd interview with director was omitted, but is their normal practice. The staff interview was the longest and most detailed as the group manager wisely let those with whom I would work vet me for that particular office. The group manager was more interested in character and integrity in his one-on-one as he was confident in his staff's approval with respect to qualifications, skill level, and demeanor. The staff interview took a little over an hour, with three staff members asking questions, more or less in rotation. By some strange coincidence I happened to seat myself at the head of the table, which I believe was positive in this instance but could just as easily have been seen as presumptive, so that is by no means a blanket recommendation.
Interview Questions: What would you point to in your background that has prepared you to perform this job? Explain the prior experience as well as its relevance to this job.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was recommended by a current employee to apply for PCT position. The process was very fast. I was contacted within a week of posting my resume. They do an inital interview with the nurse floor manager and then a subsequent interview with two of the nurses who work on that floor (or I'm guessing two other people who you will be working with.)
Interview Questions: There wasn't a specific question that stood out that was difficult. The situation questions are a little challenging because it puts you on the spot to come up with a good answer.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Except for the dean (Halushka at the time), I was not really asked any real "interview questions". For the most part each member of the admissions committee just told me how great MUSC was and why I should come here, and then asked a little bit about the research I had done previously.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about your honors thesis research from undergrad?

title: Research Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was fair and balanced. The timeline was respectable and they did a good job of keeping in contact and keeping me informed along the way. The interviewer respected my privacy as I was already an employee of the university in another position
Interview Questions: How soon was I looking to transfer

title: Radiological Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: First came into the hospital through the "pool".  The interview process was very simple and quick.  Hiring process was normal: drug test, ppd, etc.
Interview Questions: none

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: MUSC likes to call their interviewing process "Behavioral Interviews" but really they just ask you the same questions over and over.  There is no creativity in the interview and all of the people interviewing you have to ask the same questions as everyone else.  There were plenty of times that I could tell the individuals wanted to veer away from the questions, but couldn't due to the structure.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult person you have had to work with.

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions:
They had nearly 80 resume submitted for the position, so they did phone interviews to narrow the field to 5 candidates.  Those 5 were then invited for 1 on 1 interviews with the department manager, and then a group interview with the team.  I think the interview itself went well, but my long term goals may have been in conflict with the needs of the department.

I was told the job was quite demanding, and would require wearing many hats.  I was told during my phone interview with the manager that the job would pay $17 an hour, but three weeks later, when I interviewed, she told me the compensation would be $10-$11 an hour, depending upon experience.  Yikes!  Apparently, with so many applicants they felt they could fill the position for much less money.
Interview Questions: What would your plan of action be if you were to learn that the clinic had equipment failure and was behind schedule?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application from the HR website page and was called in for an interview. There were a lot of questions asked of me such as why I want this position, why would I be a good candidate and to describe how I handled an interaction with an angry customer, etc. The hiring manager was kind and he had a couple of his employees sit in for the interview. I was also asked if I had any questions of them which I did.
Interview Questions: How did you handle dealing with an angry customer?

title: Faculty C Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions:
First visit: Chair not available, few faculty at presentation
Second visit: interview with chair
Interview Questions: What percent effort will you charge your grants?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina (Charleston, SC) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by Director of Department and Manager of Department about skills with Ms Access and mainframe processes.
Interview Questions: Adapting to political environment.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Medical University of South Carolina in May 2007
Interview Descriptions: I originally interviewed with one person for a mid-level marketing position. I was called back in for a second interview with a "panel" of people I would be working with. About mid-way through the process, I realized that the position they were describing was not the one I had originally interviewed for. This was a complete waste of everyone's time and made me wonder about the management of the department.
Interview Questions: Would you be willing to work far more than the 40 hours per week you would be compensated for?
